channel.title: [FM] 2d3 II - Title Game - Mafia Concedes
channel.description:
# :game_die: [color=Dodgerblue]2d3 II[/color] :game_die: *Hosted by Solic & PoisonedSquid*
# [color=Dodgerblue]Rules[/color] General FM rules. Prodding will be done after every 24 hours of non-activity. Second Prod will result in force replacement. Host discretion for what's considered activity.
# [color=Dodgerblue]Gameplay[/color] Days will be 36 hours Nights will be 12 hours Voting is plurality. Majority is not in play until final 3. The Mafia have one factional kill per night. Any member can perform it. You cannot perform the factional kill in addition to your other night actions. The Mafia have a day and night chat.
# [color=Dodgerblue]The Setup[/color] https://i.imgur.com/c1O2sf8.png
It's simple. Two three sided dice are rolled. The first roll determines the two town power roles. The second determines the mafia power role. Afterwards, you fill with 1 Mafia Goon and 5 Vanilla Town.
[details="Each Setup Possible"] https://i.imgur.com/iEUUeO3.png [/details]
[details="Town Rolecards"] > # [color=green]Vanilla Town[/color] > You can't act at night. You're still amazing!
> # [color=green]Doctor[/color] > You can heal someone each night, preventing them from dying.
> # [color=green]Neopolitan[/color] > You may check one player each night to see if they are a Vanilla Town.
> # [color=green]Cop[/color] > You may check one player each night to see if they are a member of the Mafia.
> # [color=green]Tracker[/color] > You may follow someone each night, learning who they visit (if anyone.)
> # [color=green]Jailkeeper[/color] > Once per night you may protect someone from kills and also roleblock them. [/details]
[details="Mafia Rolecards"] > # [color=red]Mafia Goon[/color] > You aren't special, but at least you can perform the factional kill!
> # [color=red]Mafia Roleblocker[/color] > You may roleblock a player each night, preventing them from acting.
> # [color=red]Mafia Rolecop[/color] > You may learn a player's role at night. [/details]
# [color=Dodgerblue]The Prize[/color] After the game, one member of the winning faction will be selected as the MVP based on a private vote by the players in classcard and a doublevote from each host based on the performance in this game. You cannot vote for yourself. The MVP will be allowed a custom title of their choice that abides by the forum rules.
# [color=Dodgerblue]Playerlist:[/color] 1. ~~H_Hjasik~~ [color=Dodgerblue]Killed N1[/color], [color=green]**Vanilla Town**[/color] 2. BlueStorm [color=green]**Vanilla Town**[/color] 3. Simon [color=green]**Town Cop**[/color] 4. Isaac_Gonzalez [color=green]**Vanilla Town**[/color] 5. ~~Magnus~~ [color=Dodgerblue]Lynched D1[/color], [color=red]**Mafia Goon**[/color] 6. ~~WazzaAzza~~ [color=Dodgerblue]Replaced D1,[/color] Geyde [color=green]**Town Doctor**[/color] 7. MaximusPrime [color=green]**Vanilla Town**[/color] 8. Hippolytus [color=green]**Vanilla Town**[/color] 9. Icibalus [color=red]**Mafia Roleblocker**[/color]
# [color=Dodgerblue]Backups[/color]
1. Meteoro 2. Firekitten
# [color=Dodgerblue]Credit[/color]
This setup and template was completely hijacked from Marluxion.

item.title: [FM] 2d3 II - Title Game - Mafia Concedes
item.dc:creator: Firekitten
item.description:
Icibalus:

If you’re looking for a title game, Mountainous is the best option. It may be slightly wolfsided BUT it promotes good reads among villagers and the very core of what it means to be a wolf among wolves.

That’s ideal for title games, and if you’re worried about SPKs just run it as Mountainous Arson- then the wolves can’t kill the strong players immediately and they have plenty of time.

also let’s actually make people good and not rely on PR roles

Read full topic
